lines.text: [last lines]
I saw her. I know I did.
Don't you believe in Hell?
Not since I was seven.
I do.

[embarrassing Christina in the dining room while she is trying to eat some distasteful fish]
Everyone is looking at you. Swallow.
It's disgusting!
Sorry?

[angrily]
Some things are hard to swallow, and I'm not talking about the fish.
Watch out, ma'am. That's the deep part where you are.
There is no danger. I can swim.
That don't mean a thing. It's always the ones who know how that get drowned. The ones who can't, don't go near the pool.
I may be reactionary, but this is absolutely astounding - the legal wife consoling the mistress! No, no, and no!

[to Christina]
I won't have any regrets.
Swallow it.
It's not my fault. It won't go down.
Swallow!
[repeated lines]
I'll find him.
Who's there? Who's there?

[handing Christina the phone]
Here, take it. It doesn't bite. It doesn't slap, either.

[to Nicole]
I'd like to die and not see him anymore.
Die, darling! Die and do it quickly!
To commit suicide in the Seine, one doesn't need to undress.
The keys in the pool, the husband in the morgue! You dream too much about water in this house!
[first lines]
Headmaster!
Yes.
Isn't it time I rang the bell?
It's okay. I'll unload the car myself.
So it's a coincidence?
A coincidence, yes.
And Fichet. Was his being at the morgue a coincidence? And the suit. And the hotel. And now the children! Is it a coincidence that it's getting closer and closer?
